strategy: Apply a deep neural network (DNN) with multiple hidden layers and dropout regularization, using normalized input features and early stopping on a validation set. Preprocess the data by scaling numerical features using min-max normalization and encoding categorical variables via one-hot encoding with dropped columns to avoid multicollinearity. Train the DNN using stochastic gradient descent with Adam optimizer and optimize the learning rate via learning rate scheduling. This approach leverages non-linear interactions in high-dimensional feature spaces that traditional tree-based models may miss.
